Tier I.issue: LOW RECALL - missing 17 of 27 Tier I cases (63% miss rate)

Tier II.issue: LOW PRECISION - 21 false positives (many Tier I cases incorrectly downgraded to Tier II)

Tier III.issue: MODERATE - balanced but still significant errors in both directions

tier_i_to_tier_ii_downgrades.description: The DOMINANT error pattern - Tier I cases incorrectly classified as Tier II
tier_i_to_tier_ii_downgrades.root_cause: The prompt says 'later-line restriction ALONE does not downgrade to Tier II if the biomarker-directed therapy IS the guideline-recommended treatment at that line' but LLM is not following this correctly
affected_variants: IDH1 R132H in AML, IDH1 R132C in Cholangiocarcinoma

tier_ii_to_tier_iii_downgrades.root_cause: LLM not recognizing resistance markers as Tier II actionable

tier_iii_to_tier_ii_upgrades.root_cause: Over-weighting sensitivity signals without FDA biomarker requirements

cases: KRAS G12D in Pancreatic Cancer: Tier III ’ Tier I (hallucinated FDA approval)
KIT D816V in GIST: Tier II ’ Tier I (context-dependent - D816V is resistance in GIST)

key_insights.main_problem: The 'later-line' logic is too aggressive - downgrading Tier I cases to Tier II when the biomarker-directed therapy IS the standard-of-care at that treatment line
key_insights.evidence: 17 of 28 errors (60.7%) are Tier I to Tier II downgrades citing 'later-line treatment'
key_insights.pattern: LLM sees 'after prior therapy' in FDA label and auto-downgrades to Tier II, ignoring that this IS the standard approach for these biomarkers

proposed_fixes.description: Add explicit biomarker+tumor combinations where later-line therapy IS the standard (Tier I)
examples: BRAF V600E/K + NSCLC: dabrafenib+trametinib = Tier I
BRAF V600E + ATC: dabrafenib+trametinib = Tier I
PIK3CA hotspots + HR+/HER2- breast: alpelisib = Tier I
IDH1/2 mutations + AML: ivosidenib/enasidenib = Tier I
ESR1 mutations + ER+ breast: elacestrant = Tier I
KIT exon 11 + GIST: imatinib = Tier I
KIT D816V + SM: midostaurin/avapritinib = Tier I
KRAS G12C + CRC: sotorasib = Tier I

proposed_fixes.description: Clarify that RAS mutations in CRC are Tier I resistance markers (NCCN mandated testing)
proposed_fixes.rationale: KRAS/NRAS mutations in CRC exclude anti-EGFR therapy - this is Tier I because it's NCCN Category 1 mandated testing

proposed_fixes.description: Add negative list of genes that are NOT therapeutically targetable
